title: Onboarding->Following Team Page UI
custom_preconds: User should launch the MLB app for the first time
custom_steps:
1. Launch the app without save data.
2. Click the Get Started button on the welcome screen.
3. Select Skip or favorite the team and select Next button.
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the Following Team page:
|| THEN user should see the MLB logo in the top left.
|| User should also see the same background image as Favorite team
|| The title of the page, "Select additional teams to follow," is visible at the top left of the page.
|| Underneath the title copy user should see the description copy "The description copy should read “Add more teams to your clubhouse and help build your home screen on MLB.TV."
|| If the user has favorited a team, it should be pre-selected, marked with a star to indicate that it has already been favorited.
|| To the right of the logo there should be a grid of 3x10 slightly opaque boxes with the logo of each team.Only 9 boxes should be fully showing. The 4th row should be slightly peeking to show that you can continue to scroll to find your team.
|| The user should be able to scroll down with the remote control.
|| Users should be able to navigate between teams, with a white-bordered box following their cursor to indicate the team they are currently hovering over.
|| Each time the user selects a team that club should remain highlighted.
|| Towards the bottom left corner, “Skip” should always be present.
|| The  “Next” button should show next to skip. 
|| The Next button should be filled when any team is selected.
|| If the user select  back button they should be sent back to the “Welcome” and if the user select 'Next' or 'Skip' then it should navigate to “Get Started” screen.

title: Roku Account Linking Cross Roku Devices - Login
custom_preconds:
1.User should launch the App
2.Set 3 devices with the rokudev account.
3.Ensure that you logged out of MLB app in all the devices before starting this test.


Reference document : https://developer.roku.com/docs/developer-program/authentication/universal-authentication-protocol-for-single-sign-on.md
custom_steps:
Roku device 1:
1. Launch the MLB App
2. Go to Settings
3. Select Login and give the correct credentials 
4. Now Login
WHEN the 1st device is logged In
custom_expected:
||WHEN the first device is logged in | THEN user should able to watch the playback.
||WHEN the MLB app is launched on 2nd device | THEN observe the 2nd device is launched as a Auth user(Login credentials should be as first device)

title: Roku Account Linking Cross Roku Devices - LogOut
custom_preconds:
User should launch the App
Set 3 devices with the rokudev account.

Reference document : https://developer.roku.com/docs/developer-program/authentication/universal-authentication-protocol-for-single-sign-on.md
custom_steps:
Roku device 1:
1. Launch the MLB App
2. Go to Settings
3. Select Login and give the correct credentials 
4. Now Login
5. And press logout
WHEN the 1st device is logged In
AND WHEN the user Logout
custom_expected:
||WHEN the first device is logged in | THEN user should able to watch the playback.
||WHEN the MLB app is launched on 2nd device | THEN observe the 2nd device is launched as a Auth user(Login credentials should be as first device)
||WHEN the user LogOut on first device | THEN the user should be shown as Login in the second device and user should able to watch the content with no issues.
||WHEN the user launch the MLB app on third device | THEN observe the 3rd device is launched as a Unauth user.

title: Verify Game Tile
custom_preconds: 1. User should Login with a valid account (Annual / Monthly)
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Games option

When the user selects the Game Tile
custom_expected:
User should see:

* Away team should appear on the left and the home team on the right
* Team logos
* Start time of the game
* If the game is Over, "final" text should display
* If the game is Live, "Live" text should display in Red Pill
* If the game has Pregame Show, "Pregame Show" text should display
* If the game has Postgame Show, "Postgame Show" text should display

* User should see the game Score if in progress or complete

title: Verify Hide Spoilers ON ->Game Tile
custom_preconds:
1. User should Login with a valid account (Annual / Monthly)
2. Ensure the Hides Scores is 'ON'
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Games
3. User navigates to Games page

When the user selects Game Tile
custom_expected:
THEN for a scheduled game, when hide spoilers are on, I should only see the two teams and the game start time.

THEN for a live game, when hide spoilers are on, I can see the two teams and text indicating the game is live.

THEN for a live blacked out game, when hide spoilers are on I can see the blackout market flag, the live audio pill, the two teams and the live text

THEN for a final game, when hide spoilers are on, I should see the two teams, and Final Text.

THEN the Scores should be hidden.

title: Network Throttling test
custom_preconds:
Set the Network Emulator
Follow the document: https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/JTS/pages/4696660/Network+Emulator+Test+For+Connected+Devices
custom_steps:
Follow the document for App Performance & Stress Testing Due to Network Changes
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/QAspace/pages/14123103/App+Performance+Stress+Testing+Due+to+Network+Changes
custom_expected:
Intention of this test is to avoid crashes, video freezing issues, pixelation and watch the video without any lag. 

ROKU:Ensure that the test is done in below spped:
Roku: 
A high speed broadband Internet connection with 3000 Kbps dedicated bandwidth is required to stream MLB.TV content in HD
For 60 FPS HD streams, 5000 Kbps is recommended

Please refer -  https://www.mlb.com/live-stream-games/help-center/connected-devices for Network requirements.

Samsung tv only (new design)

Live Playback

The user should be shown the current time in video playback

Located above the scrubber bar to the far right

Should always be shown as a positive value

Should be hidden when the user is actively FF/RW in playback

Archive Playback

The user should be shown the total length of the video 

Located above the scrubber bar to the far right

Should always be shown as a positive value

Should be hidden when the user is actively FF/RW in playback

SLIVE

The user should be shown the current time in video playback

Located above the scrubber bar to the far right

Should always be shown as a positive value

Should be hidden when the user is actively FF/RW in playback

VOD/SVOD

The user should be shown (current time in video/total length of the video)

Located above the scrubber bar to the far right

Should always be shown as a positive value

Should be hidden when the user is actively FF/RW in playback

Designs:

https://www.figma.com/file/2mX1UOJqWUGiNTcLXZJ1r8/MLB.TV-Video-Playback-DEV?node-id=1207%3A2178

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify if the network disrupted then the other device should play the asset.
custom_preconds:
1. User should Login with the valid credentials
2. Ensure that they are 5 devices logged in with the same account.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. Navigate and select the Games View option
3. Select any Archived/Live and play the asset.
4. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 4(No need to wait a period of time between these launches.) 
5. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error. 
6. Disconnect the Wifi in one of the device.
custom_expected:
If the user's 5th device is getting the concurrency error message when playing 4 other devices and if one of the playing device's Network is disrupted, 
THEN the device having the error message should be able to play the stream.

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays -> Happy path

2. Ensure that they are 5 devices logged in with the same account.

1. User launches the MLB App
2. Navigate and select the Games View option

6. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error. 
7. Disconnect the WIFI/Playback in one of the devices playing asset.
custom_expected:
WHEN the user plays the asset in all the 5 devices then in 4 devices the user should able to stream the asset with no issues. 
But for the 5th device the user should see the concurrency error message.
